brewery.brewery_description: Australia's newest independent brewery, sharing expertly crafted brews, perfected by brewing legend Chuck Hahn.

user.bio: Murph's Grand Tour, Thinker-Maker-Ideas man, Photographer, Motorsport Fan, family guy.

beer.beer_description: Australian hops in the kettle create passionfruit notes on the palate, while dry hopping of classic American hops deliver strong fruit and citrus notes in the aroma and finish. In other words? A well-hopped pale ale to please the avid craft beer connoisseur. Pair with a charcuterie board, with rambling anecdotes from your travels.

In other words? A well-hopped pale ale to please the avid craft beer connoisseur. Pair with a charcuterie board, with rambling anecdotes from your travels.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 230 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 47!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 235 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 48.

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 340 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.

Porters and Stouts are rich with both history and flavor. Roasty, dark, and delicious, these two styles helped start it all. That’s 450 different beers with the style of Porter or Stout. Try 5 more for Level 91!

beer.beer_description: This classic German-style lager is brewed with traditional European hops, delivering a refreshing dryness, with a spicy herbaceous bitterness. Paired with a nasi goreng or green chili taco, you'll be in palate cleansing heaven. But this brew can also be enjoyed by itself, savoured with the ideal balance of hop and malt.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 215 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 44!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 470 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 95!

Everyone loves fresh beer, but obviously not as much as you do. You went straight to the source. 

That's a beer at 15 different venues categorized as a Brewery, Cidery or Meadery. Visit 5 more for Level 4!

Thank you for celebrating International Stout Day by savoring a delicious stout! Stout enthusiasts like you know that there's a world of flavor waiting to be explored within the stout family, from classic dry stouts to rich barrel-aged stouts, and everything in between. Here's a toast to the deep, complex, and delightful world of stouts!

Keep exploring the rich, roasted flavors and aromatic notes that stouts have to offer, and earn other great stout badges like Beyond a Shadow of a Stout, Heavy Weight, Dessert Time! and more.

beer.beer_description: Brewed to the German Standard with 50/50 blend of malted wheat and malted barley creates a tart, dry finish. Fermentation with special German Hefeweizen yeast creates a slight banana, fruity estery aroma. European lemon drop hops added during and at the end of the kettle boil leaves a pleasant lemony flavour and aroma.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 195 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 40!

beer.beer_description: This classic German-style lager is brewed with traditional European hops, delivering a refreshing dryness, with a spicy herbaceous bitterness. Paired with a nasi goreng or green chili taco, you'll be in palate cleansing heaven. But this brew can also be enjoyed by itself, savoured with the ideal balance of hop and malt.

items.badge_description: Guess what? We’re officially 14! From October 22nd to October 27th, we’re celebrating Untappd’s 14th anniversary (woo woo)! Thanks to every one of you for making this beautifully diverse community what it is today! Let’s raise our glasses, check in a brew, earn this badge, and cheers to the next 14 years of memories with you! For extra credit, be sure to check out the latest Hop Culture piece on the beers with most 5-star check-ins on Untappd so far in 2024.

Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 210 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 43!

It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That's 275 check-ins with a photo.  Try 5 more for Level 56!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 200 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 41!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 125 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 26! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
Do you come from the land down under, where beer does flow, and men chunder? That's at least 135 different beers from Australia. Try 5 more for Level 28.

beer.beer_description: Australian hops in the kettle create passionfruit notes on the palate, while dry hopping of classic American hops deliver strong fruit and citrus notes in the aroma and finish. In other words? A well-hopped pale ale to please the avid craft beer connoisseur. Pair with a charcuterie board, with rambling anecdotes from your travels.

The appearance of this toffee-like brew invites a highly sessionable amber. With a medium malt body, kettle hopping with American hops provides both pleasant spiced and pine-filled flavours, while dry hopping creates slight citrus notes. Pair with a rich, fresh beef ragu and lifelong friends around the fire.

This classic German-style lager is brewed with traditional European hops, delivering a refreshing dryness, with a spicy herbaceous bitterness. Paired with a nasi goreng or green chili taco, you'll be in palate cleansing heaven. But this brew can also be enjoyed by itself, savoured with the ideal balance of hop and malt.

Brewed to the German Standard with 50/50 blend of malted wheat and malted barley creates a tart, dry finish. Fermentation with special German Hefeweizen yeast creates a slight banana, fruity estery aroma. European lemon drop hops added during and at the end of the kettle boil leaves a pleasant lemony flavour and aroma.

An easy drinking lager brewed with pale malts and light German Lemondrop hops. With the addition of a secret citrus blend, your palate will welcome this inviting, refreshing lager with its mild, hoppy citrus finish. Best enjoyed with fresh seafood with homemade aioli and of course, a meandering bike ride.

Only pale malted barley, light kettle hopping, extended mash cooking and a fermentation process are used to create this very easy drinking lager with reduced calories. Gentle hopping with Ella hops from Victoria result in a light, grapefruit floral finish.
